parameters.name: connection_asset
parameters.prompt: Name of the connection asset in the project. Connection asset should be one of the 2 vector databases. i.e Elastic Search or Milvus

parameters.name: watsonx_ai_api_key
parameters.prompt: An API key for accessing IBM watsonx.ai services on IBM Cloud (optional for on-prem)

parameters.name: ingestion_data_file
parameters.prompt: The input file which needs to be extracted, processed into documents and indexed into a vector database. This file type could be PDF/DOCX/PPTX/HTML or a ZIP archive with multiple documents.

parameters.name: watsonx_ai_space_id
parameters.prompt: The Deployment Space identifier for the IBM Watson Machine Learning space where the Q&A RAG python function will be deployed.

parameters.name: vector_store_index_name
parameters.prompt: The name of the index or the collection on vector database. The accelerator will create this index/collection if it does not already exist. Use only characters with letters, numbers and underscores.

parameters.name: log_connection_asset
parameters.prompt: Name of the connection asset for logging

parameters.name: log_index_name
parameters.prompt: The name of the index or the collection on vector database for logging. Use only characters with letters, numbers and underscores.

parameters.name: expert_profiles_index
parameters.prompt: Optional. The name of the expert profiles index or the collection on vector database. The accelerator will create this index/collection if it does not already exist. Use only characters with letters and underscores.

parameters.name: expert_profiles_document
parameters.prompt: Optional. Document with expert profile data for ingestion into vector database. You can use the default file provided in the data asset section or use your own document

parameters.name: deployment_serving_name
parameters.prompt: A unique serving name required for deploying a scoring pipeline function. On IBM Cloud, this serving name must be unique within each region. Use only characters with letters, numbers and underscores.

parameters.name: cos_data_input_connection_asset
parameters.prompt: (Only for Bulk Ingestion) The name of the COS connection asset, which includes the bucket containing the input dataset for bulk indexing. This bucket is used to retrieve the data, which will then be extracted, processed into documents, and indexed into the vector database. Connection asset should be one of the 2 Cloud object storage, i.e IBM Cloud Object Storage or Amazon S3. (Optional)

parameters.name: cos_milvus_connection_asset
parameters.prompt: (Only for Bulk Ingestion) The name of the COS connection asset, which includes the Milvus-associated COS bucket name for bulk ingestion to Milvus vector database. This COS bucket is used to store processed data files for bulk ingestion into Milvus. Connection asset should be one of the 2 Cloud object storage, i.e IBM Cloud Object Storage or Amazon S3. (Optional)
